title: Boards Spam
body:
The moderators are here to serve the community. For that reason, they should have to answer to the community as to why they have done **NOTHING** about the continual spam of non-english language troll posts that are borderline racist (in that they are obviously Google Translated posts used to poke fun at how Riot is owned by a Chinese company).

This is absolutely unacceptable on any board (the racism), but especially so on boards that are intended for "legitimate discussion" such as gameplay. There is absolutely no reason that the players making these posts should still have the ability to do so (i.e. they should be at a minimum temporarily banned) but nothing has been done.

Well over 24 hours have passed. Unacceptable response time.
————
Over 48 hours and no response from the mods to the community. Unacceptable.

replies.body:
I feel the need to post here for a variety of reasons. This comment may be long.

We have indeed done our best to handle spam reports and any other reports we get, but we are not getting paid to be here. This is a volunteer position, one in which many of us work full-time jobs outside of and try to volunteer as much as we can when we do have time. The idea that you demand instant moderation and consistent moderation 24/7 out of a bunch of unpaid volunteers who are doing their best is insanity. We have lives and other obligations. I also implore you to think about this; we have players of all ages and education levels here. While some translate posts are very obvious, there is just as much of a case saying that a user could just be... bad at English. Bit of a small point, but I felt the need to express that we aren't going to just triggerhappy ban and delete posts for not being the best grammatically.

I will also like to address a comment you made in this post:

> Again, use the library analogy. Virtually everyone in a public library is a volunteer. Imagine if the books you wanted weren’t shelved because they “didn’t feel like it”. What if entire sections were unorganized because “I don’t wanna walk over there”?
>Something being volunteer doesn’t mean that those volunteers don’t have an obligation to do a job.

As a former library volunteer for 3 years, this is... rather inaccurate. I think I can count the time on one hand (that number being 2) times I've been asked to do anything related to stocking books. And it was usually "we have absolutely no work for you guys to do, so if you want to help straighten out the books on the shelf go for it." Everyone was paid who stocked or managed the library. The most we did that was similar to a librarian is that we were trained to accept and let people take out books on the system, and that was again if they were oddly low-staffed. 90% of my volunteer obligation was to work with other volunteers to create events that would be fun for the children who come to the library. We'd make buttons, holds arts & crafts, or run the weekly teens-night where people would come in and do for-fun gaming tournaments. Nothing to do with stocking books on a strict shift. We were also told if we had to leave at any time for anything it was 100% okay, and thanked for what we were able to do.

Moderators try our best, but we are not infallible beings. We cannot spend 9 hours volunteering. The notion you have expressed several times that moderators should essentially treat the Boards like a job is exactly why some mods we get have severe burnout and quit. They put in so much time and effort for no monetary gain and getting flamed all day.

You're right, volunteers should do their job! But they should also be respected as they are doing free labor for several hours a day in some cases for a Boards that hate their very existence. They are also not in a physical location to volunteer, which enables larger chunks of time to do more hands-on work. These are people who volunteer between their lunch breaks, or on their one day off on and off outside of trying to relax from a full-time job they have i nsome cases.

If you don’t have enough moderators, rectify that by on boarding more moderators. If you are losing moderators to burnout, the solution is to onboard more - then you’ll not only have more but they won’t be getting burnt out.

The obvious solution is there. If there’s not enough “qualified” people then maybe it’s time to lower the standards - but to be quite fair, there seems to be many qualified people on the boards. When’s the last time a call for mod applications went out?

You claim that your experience as a library volunteer was inaccurate - you must live in a large city with a large grant or endowment for their library, the majority of library systems don’t have such a thing. You also then go on to admit that your role as a volunteer was not at all a volunteer for the library but a side, unnecessary role. If you think moderation is unnecessary and can go without, that may be part of the problem.

Let me ask you this - since none of you will answer me - is it acceptable to have pings in the discord go unanswered for 24+ hours? As in, it’s possible that pornography or other severe rules violations could be on the boards for that long? Or that an innocent player could be banned from the boards for that long?

It should not be acceptable.

Never thought I'd see myself agreeing with a Rujitra post.

Surprisingly, at least to my belief, my posts are almost all completely logical. They may not be what you *think*, and you're certainly permitted to have your opinions, but it's very odd for two humans to be at odds in all their opinions.

Regardless, it's incompetence that it's gone on for over a day now. Perhaps some moderators saw it but "CBA" (can't be arsed) to do anything about it, in which case they should not be given the tools. Moderation is not a "summer soldier" job, and if people treat it like that they are not putting in the effort that should be minimally expected of them. Alternatively, perhaps the heralds have themselves seen the posts but refused to take action for fear of getting into a controversy - in which case they should not be leaders if they are unwilling or unable to make these controversial decisions.

That's the thing, I'm pretty certain it's not a summer job, because it isn't a job at all. It is a volunteer service and volunteers have very little obligation to actually fufilll anything completely

Again, use the library analogy. Virtually everyone in a public library is a volunteer. Imagine if the books you wanted weren’t shelved because they “didn’t feel like it”. What if entire sections were unorganized because “I don’t wanna walk over there”?

Something being volunteer doesn’t mean that those volunteers don’t have an obligation to do a job.

Hmmmm, maybe I'm just from a rich place, but literally everyone working at my library was paid and treated as either a librarian on their own or an assistant/paid intern, I guess my taxes are higher lol, but yes, by definition volunteers have no obligation to do a job, they are doing it because they want to. You can bar a volunteer from doing anything in the future, but you can't take anything away from them really, since they aren't getting anything for their service in the first place and they are there by choice. I.e. you can't "fire" a volunteer because they were never hired or worth anything to you but slave labor anyways.
A better example would be a volunteer at a charity. I could volunteer to go help with Feed My Starving Children or a food pantry and that isn't dumb by nature, it's charity which makes sense for tiny organizations and faith-based groups, but for any non-smol indie companie it is pretty stupid to expect much more than nothing, much less strict responsibilities out of people doing something just because they believe in the cause. For example, if I volunteered at a charity and they told me I had to be there at 6 every morning and lift heavy boxes for a gew hours and got mad if I was late, I would not volunteer anymore and then no one would do it. This isn't Tom Sawyer, people are not idiots anymore, doing something for someone for nothing is not a reasonable thing to ask in most cases and as such volunteers are appreciated instead of criticized bc criticized by superiors volunteers are not volunteers for much longer

Maybe. The vast majority of libraries will have one or maybe two librarians on staff, possibly a couple of full time administrative assistants, but the majority of the “staff” will be volunteer.

My point is that the boards moderators either aren’t finding people who want to do the jobs here, or they’re not managing them appropriately. There used to be a great arbiter team. Over half of those arbiters either left the mod team or stopped posting often at all. The arbiters who actually cared are gone.

The herald team had 6 people on it last I remember seeing. Multiple of them haven’t posted in months. The herald team is less than half active - regardless of any “back end” stuff they do, they’ve lost touch with the community. The only two largely active heralds are protective of each other. They will not admit that the program is poorly run, and they won’t put in the effort to make any changes - because neither enforced any modicum of effort into the other.

It’s corruption, plain and simple. It is now over 36 hours since this whole issue started. No response here. No action taken on the threads. It’s absolutely unacceptable.

> It’s corruption, plain and simple. It is now over 36 hours since this whole issue started. No response here. No action taken on the threads. It’s absolutely unacceptable.

I don't understand your deal here, rujitra. Why have you taken this on as a crusade despite the fact that you were warned about continuing to attack staff. If the place goes to hell because you think people aren't doing their "job," **why do you care?**

Because I have a right as a player to use the boards. And I should have the right to expect that the boards staff will perform their jobs, especially when it begins to impact the boards that I want to be able to use.

I was threatened with a ban for calling out improper moderation and management. That itself is one of the biggest examples of corruption in this team. They continually make excuses instead of changing, and when the boards users ask why they aren’t doing their job, they are threatened.

If I get banned for asking why 36 hours pass without any action on obvious rule violations, that is an abuse of power. Period.

Their Riot supervisor should view the boards, you’d think. If their Riot supervisor responds here, then I’ll gladly talk.

I disagree to an extent about using other proper channels as a a sign of corruption. If you go to one and ask "Can I screenshot and share our conversation to share on the boards?" and then get met with a 'No' i would be more wary (granted of you specifically name people it debatable be called Name/shame); but if you kept the focus on how you feel there aren't enough mods on/available to handle reports. There shouldn't be an issue with that being shared.

So you're saying that it is not a "proper channel" to discuss the boards on the boards? Is there not a proper channel to **publicly** voice grievances?

If that is the case, then that is absolutely absurd and needs fixed. A community should have a place in which they can voice grievances and have a conversation with their "superiors" in public.

The fact that there has not been a Rioter post on the Discuss the Boards in months, nor has Keyru herself made a post on the boards in 6 months (and even then, her most recent two were simply event updates.

I want a Rioter to publicly post admitting that they are okay with this response time and scheduling issue. None of them will do it - because they rightfully should not be okay with it and thus saying they are would be a lie.

> So you're saying that it is not a "proper channel" to discuss the boards on the boards? Is there not a proper channel to publicly voice grievances?

Rujitra, bud, you didn't leave it at "I don't understand why it's taking so long for staff to respond to reports."

You took it to an insane level of "It's corruption!" Corruption **how**? These people don't get paid for being staff. They can quit any time they want to. They do it because they want to.

You were warned in your last tirade that taking it that far would result in punishment. At this point, they should avoid punishing you because that's what you **want**. This way, you can accuse them of even more ridiculous horseshit because they banned you.

With "corruption" people have something to gain. The boards staff don't have anything to gain by not jumping on posts immediately when they're reported or within whatever standards you believe should exist.

What you're describing, were it true, would be called "mis-management" not "corruption." Nowhere anywhere does it say that a report, comment, or post will be handled by staff in any specific time period.

Again, you were told what to do should you want to escalate to Riot management, but you're refusing to do so, and it's very, very confusing why you've taken up this crusade.

Corruption because it's been almost 48 hours and I'm not being responded to, I guarantee in part due to the fact that it's me creating the post.

Corruption because there is no oversight of the heralds, in that the heralds are allowed to keep making excuses and never actually take any community feedback into account.

Corruption because they always say "that's too much work" but it's been over half a year since mod applications were solicited from the community.

Corruption because they don't ensure timely response to community concerns, the excuse being "we can't be arsed to ensure response within a few hours because we're volunteers".

Corruption because the herald team numbers over double the amount of actually active heralds - and those who are active protect their own instead of actually looking into issues.

There are many reasons why I'm calling it corruption - because it is. If that gets me banned, for calling it what it is **when no changes are being made**, then fine. I'll be a martyr to prove that the team is corrupt. If they choose to ban me for this post, **that only proves that they are corrupt**. You're right that they should avoid banning me - because that would expose them for what they are.

Rujitra, please don't put words in my mouth.{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
